questions.question: The midpoint voltage of the symmetrical lossless long transmission line is mainly depending on

answers.d: Difference between sending end angle and receiving end angle

explanations.a: Current flow does not affect the formula for calculating the midpoint voltage of a long transmission line.
explanations.b: According to the reference [11], the formula for calculating the midpoint voltage of the long transmission line is mainly depends on real power flow.
explanations.c: Reactive power flow does not affect the formula for calculating the midpoint voltage of a long transmission line.
explanations.d: Difference between sending end angle and receiving end angle does not affect the formula for calculating the midpoint voltage of a long transmission line.

questions.question: The surge impedance loading of the transmission line is defined as is

answers.a: Different value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.b: Square root of ratio of inductive reactance to capacitance reactance of the transmission line
answers.c: Equal value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.d: Square root of ratio of capacitive reactance to inductive reactance of the transmission line

explanations.a: Surge impedence needs inductive and capacitive reactance cancel each other out.
explanations.b: Surge impedence needs inductive and capacitive reactance cancel each other out.
explanations.c: Equal value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists.
explanations.d: Surge impedence needs inductive and capacitive reactance cancel each other out.

questions.question: The surge impedance of the symmetrical lossless transmission line is

answers.a: Equal value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.b: Different value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.c: Square root of ratio of the inductive reactance to capacitance reactance of the transmission line
answers.d: Square root of ratio of the capacitive reactance to inductive reactance of the transmission line

explanations.a: The condition is not called surge impedance loading condition if the reactive power generation is not equal to the reactive power absorption.
explanations.b: The condition is not called surge impedance loading condition if the reactive power generation is not equal to the reactive power absorption.
explanations.c: According to the reference [4], In a long transmission line, if the reactive power generation is equal to the reactive power absorption, that condition is called surge impedance loading condition.
explanations.d: The condition is not called surge impedance loading condition if the reactive power generation is not equal to the reactive power absorption.

questions.question: In a 735-kV symmetrical lossless transmission line with inductance of 0.932 mH/ km, capacitance of 12.2 nF/ km, and a line length of 800 km. The surge impedance of the transmission line is

explanations.a: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by Zc=√(L/C).
explanations.b: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by Zc=√(L/C).
explanations.c: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by Zc=√(L/C).
explanations.d: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by Zc=√(L/C).

questions.question: In a 735-kV symmetrical lossless transmission line with inductance of 0.932 mH/ km, capacitance of 12.2 nF/ km, and a line length of 800 km. The surge impedance loading of the transmission line is

explanations.a: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by SIL=(V^2)/Z.
explanations.b: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by SIL=(V^2)/Z.
explanations.c: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by SIL=(V^2)/Z.
explanations.d: The formula for surge impedence of transmission is given by SIL=(V^2)/Z.
